verses.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. LORD, thou hast been favorable to thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.
Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
Thou hast taken away all thy wrath; thou hast turned \add thyself\add* from the fierceness of thy anger.
Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thy anger towards us to cease.
Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thy anger to all generations?
Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?
Show us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy salvation.
I will hear what God the LORD will speak: for he will speak peace to his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.
Surely his salvation \add is\add* nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.
Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed \add each other\add* .
Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Yes, the LORD will give \add that which is\add* good; and our land shall yield her increase.
Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set \add us\add* in the way of his steps.
